zone.line: [f. 24r is blank]
Draining
Sucking the poison of despair, shall take
And interchange sweet nutriment; to me
Shall they become like sister-antelopes
By one fair dam, snowwhite & swift as wind
Nursed among lilies near a brimming stream;
The dew mists of my sunless sleep shall float
Under the stars like balm, night-folded flowers
Shall suck unwithering colours as they dream
And men & beasts in happy dream s shall gather
Strength for the coming day & all its joy240
And death shall be the last embrace of her
Who takes the life she gave, even as a mother
Folding her child, says, leave me not again!
Asia
O mother wherefore speak the name of death ?
Cease they to love & move & breathe & speak
Who die?
The Earth
The It would avail not to reply
Thou art immortal & this tongue is known
But
Only to the uncommunicating dead —
Death is the veil which those who live call
They life
Men sleep — & it is lifted... & meanwhile
